content:
A Note about CS 122B Course Grades
for Spring 2009

Good job, folks -- a class average of 81 percent, with teh highest scorig groups only missing a couple of points (out of 25). After thinking over the difficulty of the phases, looking at the score distribution, and considering the granularity of the grading system (e.g., one point more could raise your letter grade a notch), I decided to drop the grade cut offs by 10 points from those given in the Course Reference.

The scores on the course spreadsheet are in order of the last four digits of the student ID number (the first column). After your ID comes the code score and the demonstration score for each of the graded FabFlix's phases. Next is your point total for the code and that total as a percentage; then comes your letter grade.

Do check over your scores; if you find any which are incorrect and that would change your final grade in the course contact me; since my schedule during the summer tends to be erratic, it ’s probably best to send me e-mail about the problem.

Enjoy the summer!

Norman Jacobson
